## Data and packages


# Why do we need joins


```{python}
people
```


```{python}
test_info
```

```{python}
pd.concat([people, test_info], axis=1)
```

```{python}
test_info_disordered
```

```{python}
pd.concat([people, test_info_disordered], axis=1)
```

```{python}
test_info_multiple
```

```{python}
pd.concat([people, test_info_multiple], axis=1)
```
## Using the more efficient merge()

```{python}
pd.merge(people, test_info)
```

```{python}
pd.merge(people, test_info_disordered)
```

```{python}
pd.merge(people, test_info_multiple)
```

## The pd.merge() syntax

```{python}
 # left and right
pd.merge(left=people, right=test_info)  # keyword arguments
```

```{python}
pd.merge(people, test_info)  # positional arguments
```

```{python}
# on argument is optional if the column key is the same in both dataframes
pd.merge(people, test_info, on="name")

```

## Practice Q: Join with 'on'


```{python}
customer_details
```

```{python}
order_records
```

```{python}
# Performing join
pd.merge(left = customer_details, right = order_records, left_on="id_number", right_on="customer_code" )
```

## Practice Q: Left join TB cases and continents


```{python}
tb_cases_children
```

```{python}
country_continents
```


```{python}
pd.merge(
    country_continents,
    tb_cases_children,
    left_on="country.name.en",
    right_on="country",
    how="left",
)
```

## Right join - flip side of the left join 
This keeps the right table

## inner join

```{python}
test_info_xavier
```


# Practice Q: inner join total sales and product feedback

```{python}
total_sales
```

```{python}
product_feedback
```

```{python}
pd_sales_feedback = pd.merge(total_sales, product_feedback, how="inner")
pd_sales_feedback
```
# Insights
There are 7 products common between the two datasets

```{python}
# highest ratio of positive reviews to total units sold
pd_sales_feedback["ratio_fdbk_sales"] = pd_sales_feedback["n_positive_reviews"]/pd_sales_feedback["total_units_sold"]
pd_sales_feedback.sort_values("ratio_fdbk_sales", ascending=False)
```
The product, "Desktop" has the highest ration (0.94) of positive reviews to total units sold
